definition:
The subset $\{0\}$ of a ring $R$ is the least two-sided ideal of $R$. As
a principal ideal, it is often denoted by $$(0)$$ and called the [*zero
ideal*]{}.\
The zero ideal is the identity element in the addition of ideals and the
absorbing element in the . The quotient ring $R/(0)$ is trivially
isomorphic to $R$.

By the entry quotient ring modulo prime ideal, (0) is a prime ideal if
and only if $R$ in an integral domain.
